revision.text:
{{For|other treaties signed in Adrianople (Edirne)|Treaty of Edirne (disambiguation)}} The '''Treaty of Adrianople''' (also called the '''Treaty of Edirne''') was signed on 16/27 June 1713 between the [[Ottoman Empire]] and the [[Tsardom of Russia]], confirming the [[Treaty of the Pruth]] of 1711 which had ended the [[Pruth River Campaign|Pruth River Campaign (1710–1711)]]. The Treaty of Pruth, signed by [[Baltacı Mehmet Pasha]], was first received well in Constantinople. But the dissatisfied pro-war party, supported by King [[Charles XII of Sweden]] who had taken refuge in the Ottoman Empire since 1709, turned general opinion against [[Baltacı Mehmet Pasha]], who was finally relieved from his office.
But Sultan [[Ahmed III]] didn't resume the war with Russia. Finally the Sultan became annoyed by the pro-war party and decided to send the troublesome Swedish King back to his homeland. This removed all obstacles for a final peace settlement with Russia and the Treaty of Adrianople was a peace agreement for the next 25 years. ==References== {{no footnotes|date=November 2015}} * ''Советская военная Энциклопедия.'' Band 1. Воениздат, Москва 1976, S. 117, (Sovjet Military Encyclopedia). {{DEFAULTSORT:Treaty of Adrianople 1713}} [[Category:Russo-Turkish Wars]] [[Category:Peace treaties of Russia|Adrianople 1713]] [[Category:Peace treaties of the Ottoman Empire|Adrianople 1713]] [[Category:1713 treaties|Adrianople]] [[Category:Treaties of the Russian Empire|Adrianople 1713]] [[Category:History of Edirne]] [[Category:1713 in Europe]]
